root.para: The volume and sophistication of financial instrument activity and relevant regulatory requirements will influence the entity’s consideration whether to establish a formal risk management function and how the function may be structured. In entities that have not established a separate risk management function (for example, entities with relatively few financial instruments or financial instruments that are less complex), reporting on and monitoring financial instrument activities may be a component of the accounting or finance function’s responsibility or management’s overall responsibility and may include a formal risk committee established by those charged with governance.
